title: Set up Express server with WebSocket support

comments.author: Herb Caudill
comments.text:
## Summary

Set up Express server with WebSocket support as the foundation for the ralph-ui backend.

### Changes Made

**New Files:**
- `server/index.ts` - Main server file with:
  - Express app with JSON parsing and health endpoint
  - Placeholder API endpoints for ralph control (`/api/start`, `/api/stop`, `/api/message`)
  - WebSocket server at `/ws` with:
    - Heartbeat mechanism (30s ping/pong)
    - Client connection tracking
    - `broadcast()` function for sending to all clients
    - Message handling with ping/pong support
  - Port availability checking with fallback
  - SPA static file serving from `dist/`
- `server/index.test.ts` - Tests for health endpoint and WebSocket functionality
- `tsconfig.server.json` - TypeScript config for Node.js server code

**Modified Files:**
- `package.json` - Added `express`, `ws`, `@types/express`, `@types/ws`, `tsx` deps; added `dev:server` script
- `tsconfig.json` - Added reference to server tsconfig
- `vitest.config.ts` - Added `environmentMatchGlobs` to run server tests in Node environment

### Usage

Start the server:
```bash
pnpm dev:server
```

The server runs at `http://localhost:3000` (or next available port) with WebSocket at `ws://localhost:3000/ws`.
